paper.title: Symbolic Model Checking without BDDs

author.org: Istituto per la Ricerca Scientifica e Tecnologica (IRST)

paper.venue: Tools and Algorithms for Construction and Analysis of Systems
paper.abstract: Symbolic Model Checking [3, 14] has proven to be a powerful technique for the verification of reactive systems. BDDs [2] have traditionally been used as a symbolic representation of the system. In this paper we show how boolean decision procedures, like Stalmarcku0027s Method [16] or the Davis u0026 Putnam Procedure [7], can replace BDDs. This new technique avoids the space blow up of BDDs, generates counterexamples much faster, and sometimes speeds up the verification. In addition, it produces counterexamples of minimal length. We introduce a bounded model checking procedure for LTL which reduces model checking to propositional satisfiability. We show that bounded LTL model checking can be done without a tableau construction. We have implemented a model checker BMC, based on bounded model checking, and preliminary results are presented.
